Title: Letter from J. L. Brent to Reginald Dykers, 1905 March 10
Abstract (Description): Brent accepts an invitation to sit on a committee of "friends & admirers" of Dr. W. C. Stubbs for a banquet in his honor at which Stubbs will be "tenderized."
Biographical Information: The Louisiana Sugar Planters' Association was founded in 1877 by a group of prominent planters.  Based in New Orleans, the group was largely responsible for setting in motion the modernization of Louisiana's sugar industry.  It merged with the American Cane Growers' Association in 1922, creating the American Sugar Cane League.
Note [content] (Note): Reginald Dykers was secretary of the Louisiana Sugar Planters' Association.

Biographical Information: The Louisiana Sugar Planters' Association was founded in 1877 by a group of prominent planters.  Based in New Orleans, the group was largely responsible for setting in motion the modernization of Louisiana's sugar industry.  It merged with the American Sugar Cane League.
Note [content] (Note): Reginald Dykers was secretary of the Louisiana Sugar Planters' Association.
